bug.short_desc: VPN access for bsavage@ to access Mozilla-MPT

long_desc.thetext: I need access to Mozilla-MPT and the documentation instructs the filing of a request.

I am still having some trouble accessing the VPN. Log is below:
Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: IMPORTANT: OpenVPN's default port number is now 1194 Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: WARNING: No server certificate verification method has been enabled. See http://openvpn.net/howto.html#mitm for more info. Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: WARNING: file 'Client.key' is group or others accessible Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: WARNING: file 'Tls-auth.key' is group or others accessible Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: Control Channel Authentication: using 'Tls-auth.key' as a OpenVPN static key file Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: Outgoing Control Channel Authentication: Using 160 bit message hash 'SHA1' for HMAC authentication Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: Incoming Control Channel Authentication: Using 160 bit message hash 'SHA1' for HMAC authentication Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: LZO compression initialized Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: Control Channel MTU parms [ L:1558 D:166 EF:66 EB:0 ET:0 EL:0 ] Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: Data Channel MTU parms [ L:1558 D:1450 EF:58 EB:135 ET:0 EL:0 AF:3/1 ] Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: Local Options hash (VER=V4): '9e7066d2' Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: Expected Remote Options hash (VER=V4): '162b04de' Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: UDPv4 link local: [undef] Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: UDPv4 link remote: 63.245.208.142:1194 Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: TLS: Initial packet from 63.245.208.142:1194 Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: VERIFY OK: depth=1 Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: VERIFY OK: depth=0 Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: Data Channel Encrypt: Cipher 'AES-256-CBC' initialized with 256 bit key Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: Data Channel Encrypt: Using 160 bit message hash 'SHA1' for HMAC authentication Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: Data Channel Decrypt: Cipher 'AES-256-CBC' initialized with 256 bit key Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: Data Channel Decrypt: Using 160 bit message hash 'SHA1' for HMAC authentication Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: Control Channel: TLSv1 Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: [server] Peer Connection Initiated with 63.245.208.142:1194 Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: SENT CONTROL [server]: 'PUSH_REQUEST' (status=1) Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: PUSH: Received control message: 'PUSH_REPLY Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: OPTIONS IMPORT: timers and/or timeouts modified Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: OPTIONS IMPORT: --ifconfig/up options modified Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: OPTIONS IMPORT: route options modified Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: OPTIONS IMPORT: --ip-win32 and/or --dhcp-option options modified Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: gw 10.250.0.1 Fri 04/08/11 09:20 AM: Cannot allocate TUN/TAP dev dynamically
What operating system are you using?
Were in the building are you located?
I work remotely so I don't have a specific location; I'll be in F or G on 3rd for most of the afternoon (after lunch).
Sounds like you want to handle this after lunch. I'll look for you then.
It was mentioned that I should provide my public key for VPN to work, which I never did. Should I have provided a public key when I filed this issue?
No, you don't need an ssh key. Would you like me to come up and get this resolved?
Sure. I'm in FAIL right now; I can step out whenever you're ready.
No worries, I'll come up there.
Gave Brandon license key and Info via email, closing out bug. Brandon, please reopen if the problem persist.
